senses.hearing: Inability to screen out background noise
senses.touch: Inability to distinguish between tactile stimuli of differnt intensity
senses.smell: Inability to distinguish between strong and weak smells
senses.taste: Inability to distinguish between strong and weak tastes
senses.proprioception: Inability to coordinate body position and movements of body parts
senses.balance: Inability to distinguish between 'inner' and 'outer' movements

name: Inability to stop feeling a change

senses.proprioception: Feeling only some parts of the body

senses.vision: Poor/distorted depth and space perception; seeing 2D world; distortions of shape, size

senses.proprioception: Delayed processing of body postures, body sensations
senses.balance: Delayed processing of movement of head/body

senses.vision: Vision is too acute, sees things others do not see
senses.hearing: Hearing is too acute, hears things others do not hear
senses.touch: Oversensitive to touch; difficulty with clothes
senses.smell: Cannot tolerate how people or objects smell
senses.taste: Cannot tolerate certain foods; gag/vomit easily
senses.proprioception: Odd body posturing, difficuty manipulating small objects
senses.balance: Low tolerance for any activity that involves movement or quick changes in the position of the body

senses.vision: Difficulty working out where objects are, touching everything in an unfamiliar room, attracted to bright lights
senses.hearing: Sound seeker; enjoy noisy places, create lound noises
senses.touch: Appear not to feel pain or hot or cold temperatures
senses.proprioception: Floppy, unaware of body sensations (eg do not feel hunger), bump into objects, tendancy to fall
senses.balance: enjoy and seek all kinds of movement, can spin for a long time without feeling dizzy
